issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

Eucalyptus 4.0 (4.0.0-0.0.1026.20140514git54d77aa6.el6.x86_64) cloud configured with DAS:

{code}
[root@odc-f-18 ~]# euca-describe-properties | grep EDU.storage
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.blockstoragemanager	das
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.chapuser	<unset>
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.dasdevice	/dev/vg01
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.deletedvolexpiration	24
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.maxconcurrentsnapshotuploads	3
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.maxsnapshotpartsqueuesize	5
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.maxsnaptransferretries	50
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.maxtotalvolumesizeingb	100
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.maxvolumesizeingb	15
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.ncpaths	<unset>
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.resourceprefix	<unset>
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.resourcesuffix	<unset>
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.sanhost	<unset>
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.sanpassword	********
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.sanuser	<unset>
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.scpaths	<unset>
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.shouldtransfersnapshots	true
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.snapshotpartsizeinmb	100
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.snapshotuploadtimeoutinhours	48
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.storeprefix	iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.tasktimeout	<unset>
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.tid	6
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.timeoutinmillis	10000
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.volumesdir	//var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes
PROPERTY	EDU.storage.zerofillvolumes	false
{code}

fails to track proper state of volumes. 

*output of euca-describe-volumes verbose*

{code}
[root@odc-f-18 ~]# euca-describe-volumes verbose
VOLUME	vol-7cfa1a30	2		EDU	available	2014-05-21T15:09:25.603Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-03442b7e	2		EDU	in-use	2014-05-20T14:45:40.986Z	standard
ATTACHMENT	vol-03442b7e	i-e64ad6db	/dev/sdf	attached	2014-05-21T15:07:38.907Z
{code}

*volumes tracked in DB*

{code}
[root@odc-f-18 ~]# psql -h /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/ -p 8777 eucalyptus_storage -c "select * from volumes;"
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |       create_time       |      deletion_t
ime      | sc_name | size | snapshot_id |  status   | volume_user_name | volume_name  | zone
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+-------------------------+----------------
---------+---------+------+-------------+-----------+------------------+--------------+------
 8ae88abc45fa6b0501461a18565a538a | 2014-05-20 07:45:41.082 | 2014-05-20 07:45:42.206 | 435bda43-cb9a-4ad9-976c-27dce8aafbe7 |       1 | 2014-05-20 07:45:41.082 |
         | EDU     |    2 |             | available | eucalyptus       | vol-03442b7e |
 8ae88abc45fa6b0501461f546eff152d | 2014-05-21 08:09:25.631 | 2014-05-21 08:09:26.366 | df50be40-39ce-4555-b7e1-828e4fc19684 |       1 | 2014-05-21 08:09:25.631 |
         | EDU     |    2 |             | available | eucalyptus       | vol-7cfa1a30 |
 8ae88abc45fa6b0501461f3dcd781434 | 2014-05-21 07:44:42.488 | 2014-05-21 08:14:14.517 | 3618d6ab-4b47-4a38-b493-f0e7a31d7cf9 |       3 | 2014-05-21 07:44:42.488 | 2014-05-21 08:1
4:14.517 | EDU     |    2 |             | deleted   | eucalyptus       | vol-dec4510a |
(3 rows)
{code}

As you can see, 'vol-03442b7e' is in an _attached_ state, but in the DB, it shows it as _available_.  However, if you check on the NC, the volume 'vol-dec4510a' thats in the _deleted_ state in the database, is showing as attached on the NC.

*section in nc.log*

{code}
...
2014-05-21 08:31:50 DEBUG 000001876 doDescribeInstances      | [i-e64ad6db] Extant (running) pub=10.104.3.194 vols=vol-03442b7e:A,vol-dec4510a:a
2014-05-21 08:31:56 DEBUG 000001876 doDescribeInstances      | [i-e64ad6db] Extant (running) pub=10.104.3.194 vols=vol-03442b7e:A,vol-dec4510a:a
2014-05-21 08:32:02 DEBUG 000001876 doDescribeInstances      | [i-e64ad6db] Extant (running) pub=10.104.3.194 vols=vol-03442b7e:A,vol-dec4510a:a
2014-05-21 08:32:08 DEBUG 000001876 doDescribeInstances      | [i-e64ad6db] Extant (running) pub=10.104.3.194 vols=vol-03442b7e:A,vol-dec4510a:a
...
{code}

From the looks of the errors in the nc.log, since the instances are instance store-backed HVM, and the block device 'vdb' is in use by ephemeral, its attempting to attach volumes to the device 'vdb', and failing.  However, the nc.log reports the volumes being associated to the instance (once the logging level was changed to DEBUG on the NC).
{code}
2014-05-21 07:48:18 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00020001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 1 of 3
2014-05-21 07:48:21 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:48:21 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00020001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 2 of 3
2014-05-21 07:48:24 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:48:24 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00020001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 3 of 3
2014-05-21 07:48:27 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00020001' to guest device 'vdb' after 3 tries
2014-05-21 07:48:28 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed error=1
{code}

*Pertinent Data*

This was brought to my attention by [~dpottangadi] while she was doing some testing to create an [EBS-backed EMI from an existing instance store-backed instance|https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/201605884-Creating-an-Ubuntu-EBS-backed-EMI-from-an-Existing-Instance-Store-Backed-Instance].  She had issues attaching the volumes.  Volumes would go from 'attaching' to 'available'.   One of the volumes was able to attach, only after it failed the first time.

*Signs*

* Failed volume attachment errors in nc.log:
{code}
2014-05-21 07:48:18 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:48:18 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00020001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 1 of 3
2014-05-21 07:48:21 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:48:21 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00020001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 2 of 3
2014-05-21 07:48:24 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:48:24 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00020001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 3 of 3
2014-05-21 07:48:27 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00020001' to guest device 'vdb' after 3 tries
2014-05-21 07:48:28 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed error=1
2014-05-21 07:52:56 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:52:56 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00030001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 1 of 3
2014-05-21 07:52:59 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:52:59 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00030001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 2 of 3
2014-05-21 07:53:02 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:53:02 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00030001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 3 of 3
2014-05-21 07:53:05 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00030001' to guest device 'vdb' after 3 tries
2014-05-21 07:53:07 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-03442b7e] failed error=1
2014-05-21 07:53:37 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:53:37 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-dec4510a] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00040001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 1 of 3
2014-05-21 07:53:40 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:53:40 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-dec4510a] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00040001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 2 of 3
2014-05-21 07:53:43 ERROR | libvirt: operation failed: target vdb already exists (code=9)
2014-05-21 07:53:43 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-dec4510a] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00040001' to guest device 'vdb' on attempt 3 of 3
2014-05-21 07:53:46 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-dec4510a] failed to attach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_00040001' to guest device 'vdb' after 3 tries
2014-05-21 07:53:48 ERROR | [i-e64ad6db][vol-dec4510a] failed error=1
{code}
fields.summary: Eucalyptus 4.0.0 Cloud With DAS Doesn't Track Proper State of Volumes and Causing Volume Attachment Issues
fields.environment:
*non-HA, single cluster
** 1 x CLC, Walrus, CC, SC
** 1 x UFS
** 1 x NC
* Edge networking mode
{code}
[root@odc-f-18 ~]# euca-describe-properties cloud.network.network_configuration
PROPERTY	cloud.network.network_configuration	{
    "InstanceDnsDomain": "eucalyptus.internal",
    "InstanceDnsServers": ["10.1.1.254"],
    "PublicIps": [
        "10.104.3.192-10.104.3.210"
    ],
    "Subnets": [
    ],
    "Clusters": [
        {
            "Name": "EDU",
            "MacPrefix": "d0:0d",
            "Subnet": {
                "Name": "10.105.0.0",
                "Subnet": "10.105.0.0",
                "Netmask": "255.255.0.0",
                "Gateway": "10.105.0.1"
            },
            "PrivateIps": [
                "10.105.3.101-10.105.3.163"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
{code}

SERVICE	cloudwatch        	EDU_CW    	EDU_CW               	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.62:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:bootstrap:EDU_CW:cloudwatch:EDU_CW/
SERVICE	compute           	EDU_Compute	EDU_Compute          	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.62:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:EDU_Compute:compute:EDU_Compute/
SERVICE	euare             	EDU_Euare 	EDU_Euare            	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.62:8773/services/Euare	arn:euca:bootstrap:EDU_Euare:euare:EDU_Euare/
SERVICE	loadbalancing     	EDU_LB    	EDU_LB               	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.62:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:EDU_LB:loadbalancing:EDU_LB/
SERVICE	objectstorage     	EDU_OSG   	EDU_OSG              	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.62:8773/services/objectstorage	arn:euca:bootstrap:EDU_OSG:objectstorage:EDU_OSG/
SERVICE	tokens            	EDU_Tokens	EDU_Tokens           	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.62:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:bootstrap:EDU_Tokens:tokens:EDU_Tokens/
SERVICE	bootstrap         	bootstrap 	10.104.10.60         	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.60:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.10.60/
SERVICE	reporting         	bootstrap 	10.104.10.60         	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.60:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.10.60/
SERVICE	loadbalancingbackend	eucalyptus	10.104.10.60         	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.60:8773/services/LoadBalancingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::loadbalancingbackend:10.104.10.60/

SERVICE	eucalyptus        	eucalyptus	10.104.10.60         	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.60:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.10.60/
SERVICE	cloudwatchbackend 	eucalyptus	10.104.10.60         	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.10.60:8773/services/CloudWatchBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::cloudwatchbackend:10.104.10.60/

comments.body:
History of volume interaction:

{code}
$ euca-attach-volume -i i-e64ad6db -d /dev/sdf vol-03442b7e  ## went from attaching to available ##
$ euca-detach-volume vol-03442b7e
$ euca-attach-volume -i i-e64ad6db  -d /dev/vdb vol-03442b7e ## went from attaching to available ##
$ euca-attach-volume -i i-e64ad6db  -d /dev/vdb vol-03442b7e ## went from attaching to available ##
$ euca-attach-volume vol-03442b7e -i i-e64ad6db  -d /dev/sdf  ## went from attaching to attached ##
$ euca-delete-volume vol-dec4510a
{code}

Storage Controller database does not track the attachment status of volumes to instances. This is intentional since SC does not know about the instances. For volume attachment state look at the metadata_instances_volume_attachments in eucalyputs_cloud database.
[~swathi] can you or [~wwannemacher] jump on this one?

From the logs on the NC it looks like the volume attachment failed when the device requested was vdb. The volume correctly transitioned from attaching->available. The attachment worked when a different device was used.
